Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: வீழுநர் வீழப் படுவார்க்கு அமையுமேவாழுநம் என்னும் செருக்கு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Who love and are beloved to them alone Belongs the boast, 'We've made life's very joys our own.'.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A couple who are mutually in love ('Veezhunar Veezhap Paduvaarkku') stand together, their posture radiating confidence and joy.
Layered_Composition.Midground: From them emanates a powerful, regal aura of pride and fulfillment ('Serukku'). They are looking out at the world as if they have conquered it.
Layered_Composition.Background: The world before them is beautiful and vibrant, appearing as their kingdom. This pride is not arrogant, but a deep, confident joy that comes from the security of their mutual love. The words 'வாழ்வு நம்' ('Life is ours') are subtly woven into their aura.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: Only those who experience mutual love can possess the profound and confident pride of feeling that they truly 'live' and that life belongs to them.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The regal aura of pride. Their confident, king-and-queen-like posture. The world appearing as their beautiful domain.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: Bright, triumphant, golden-hour sunlight. The colors are rich and royal—golds, deep reds, and vibrant greens—to match the feeling of noble pride.

Technical_Cues.Camera: Low-angle shot, making the couple appear heroic and larger-than-life, befitting their inner sense of pride.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, photorealistic, capturing their confident and joyful expressions.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Heroic backlighting from the sun, creating a powerful and glorious silhouette.

Negative_Prompt: a sad or timid couple, a desolate world, dark lighting, text artifacts, modern clothing, cartoonish.
